turn.0: Hi, I'm your automated assistant. I can answer your questions about Phthalate.
turn.1: Are there any other interesting aspects about this article on phthalate?
turn.2: The same study found that DEHP, BBzP, and DnOP were in significantly higher concentrations in dust samples collected in homes where polishing agents were used.
turn.4: Data on flooring materials was collected, but there was not a significant difference in concentrations between homes where no polish was used that have balatum (PVC or linoleum) flooring and homes with wood.
turn.5: Did they find any other differences?
turn.6: High frequency of dusting did decrease the concentration.
turn.7: Was there any other interesting aspects?
turn.8: In general, children's exposure to phthalates is greater than that of adults.
turn.9: Do they find out how much greater?
turn.10: In a 1990s Canadian study that modeled ambient exposures, it was estimated that daily exposure to DEHP was 9 μg/kg bodyweight/day in infants, 19 μg/kg bodyweight/day in toddlers, 14 μg/kg bodyweight/day in children, and 6 μg/kg bodyweight/day in adults.
turn.12: Infants and toddlers are at the greatest risk of exposure, because of their mouthing behavior.
